Australia:
The completion of the railway network between Adelaide, Brisbane, Melbourne and Sydney.
Sir Henry Parkes delivered the Tenterfield Oration.
Brazil:
Field Marshal Deodoro da Fonseca organizes a military coup which deposes Emperor Pedro II of Brazil and abolishes the Brazilian monarchy. Deodoro da Fonseca proclaims Brazil a Republic and forms a Provisional Government.
The Brazilian Imperial Family is forced into exile in France.
The modern-day flag of Brazil is adopted by the Provisional Government of the Republic.
Argentina is the first country to recognize the abolition of the monarchy in Brazil.
Colombia:
Foundation of Villa Holguin (Later Armenia, Colombia ) by Jesus Maria Ocampo
The Thousand Days War (1899–1902) (Spanish: Guerra de los Mil Días)
Estonia: Policy of Russification introduced where Baltic German legal and educational institutions are abolished or transformed into Russian
France:
The Eiffel Tower is opened to the public.
The Eiffel Tower lifts begin service.
Haiti:
President Légitime is overthrown; the Constituent Assembly installs a provisional government
The Constituent Assembly elects Florvil Hyppolite to a seven-year term as president
Italy: Somalia is established as the second Italian colony in Africa.
Philippine: La Solidaridad is first published in Spain as the Propaganda Movement's organ. El Ilocano is established; country's first local newspaper (1889–1896).
Serbia: King Milan Obrenović abdicates the throne in favour of his minor (age) son Aleksandar Obrenović. Austrophile policy continues.
Slovenia: Strike of coal miners in the Central Sava Valley in Zagorje and Trbovlje.
